Key Match Events: Bam Adebayo recorded a game-high 32 points on 12-of-24 shooting, including 3-of-5 from 3-point range
Jimmy Butler followed with 18 points, eight rebounds, and four assists
Tyler Herro and Alec Burks each posted 15 points
Terry Rozier tallied 12 points with four assists
Miami dominated the battle on the glass, finishing a plus-21 (65-44) – hauling down 21 offensive rebounds with 21 second-chance points
Post-Match Reflections: Bam Adebayo played with energy and was a threat from everywhere
This was a revival game for Bam, and the next 10 games will show where the team stands
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pelle Larsson had seven points, one rebound, and two assists on 3-of-4 shooting with one triple in 14 minutes
First-round rookie Kel’el Ware saw three minutes of action at the end of the game
Thomas Bryant got primary backup big minutes behind Adebayo
Second-year wing Bilal Coulibaly was the biggest standout from Saturday’s game on Washington’s side, adding a team-high 22 points on 8-of-12 shooting with eight rebounds and two assists
Alex Sarr had 17 points, six rebounds, three assists, and four blocks
Others: Miami Heat secured their third victory of the season
This marked their first double-digit victory
The Heat will face Sacramento on Monday
The team then has a rough 6-game road trip to Phoenix, Denver, Minnesota, Detroit, and Indiana twice
Washington’s folks may have talked to Miami about a Kuzma trade
